result.execSummary:
The defendant Cameron Brandell Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Possess no controlled substances.
AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety to be monitored by random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cameron Brandell Long

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Cameron Brandell Long
Current: 42451 W Somerset Drive, Maricopa, AZ 85138 United States  (Effective: 10-02-2017)
Prior: 546 North 29th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Defendant Cameron Brandell Long in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bond of $100.00 paid on 7/12/15.  sb

Defendant Cameron Brandell Long in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court admonished the defendant as to his new case.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cameron Brandell Long in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Cameron Brandell Long in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/15/15 @ 1:30pm
